alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 1:19PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Union and southeastern Columbia Counties, Webster, Claiborne and northern Bossier Parishes through 215 PM CDT... At 118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of thunderstorms along a line extending from Louann to Cullen to near Benton. The outflow boundary ahead of the line could produce winds up to 45 mph. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Minden, Springhill, Homer, Smackover, Norphlet, Junction City, Haynesville, Cullen, Cotton Valley, Sarepta, Calion, Emerson, Shongaloo, Mount Holly, Atlanta, Wesson, Village, Lisbon and Welcome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Arkansas...and north central and northwestern Louisiana.
